metadata.Title: CVE-2016-9675 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
openjpeg: A heap-based buffer overflow flaw was found in the patch forCVE-2013-6045. A crafted j2k image could cause the application to crash, orpotentially execute arbitrary code.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-9675` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libopenjpeg-java - 1.5.2-1
libopenjpeg5 - 1.5.2-1
openjpeg-tools - 1.5.2-1
openjpip-dec-server - 1.5.2-1
openjpip-server - 1.5.2-1
openjpip-viewer - 1.5.2-1
openjpip-viewer-xerces - 1.5.2-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: openjpeg package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.5.2-1').
